intro: Bupleurum hamiltonii var. humile, commonly known as the small-leaf bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated for traditional herbal use.
